com.yantra.ycp.japi.util

Interface YCPExceptionResolver


  • public interface YCPExceptionResolver
    The Interface will indicate if it is ok to resolve the exception or to ignore the resolution.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document canExceptionBeResolved(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YCPExceptionResolver interface is called by the resolveException API before executing any application logic.This method will return an XML indicating if it is ok to resolve the exception or to ignore the resolution.

    • Method Detail

      • canExceptionBeResolved

        org.w3c.dom.Document canExceptionBeResolved(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)

        The YCPExceptionResolver interface is called by the resolveException API before executing any application logic.This method will return an XML indicating if it is ok to resolve the exception or to ignore the resolution.

        To code custom logic, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This Interface is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain information about whether to resolve the exception or not.


        env Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the interface to raise errors and access environment information. inXML Required. Any XML document that contains a sufficient amount of data to resolve an Exception as required by the resolveException API. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        A status document that will indicate the following
        1. It is ok to resolve the exception.
        2. It is Not OK to resolve the exception, with a error code indicating the reason why it should not be resolved. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
